meanings.definition: In a cunning or deceitful manner
meanings.sent1: He slyly tricked his friend into giving him the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The fox slyly approached the henhouse, ready to pounce.
meanings.sent3: The cat slyly batted at the toy mouse, pretending to be innocent.
meanings.sent4: Her smile slyly concealed her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The magician slyly made the coin disappear before our eyes.

meanings.definition: In a secretive or sneaky way
meanings.sent1: She slyly slipped out of the room without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent2: The spy slyly passed the secret documents to his contact.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon slyly raided the garbage can under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent4: The shadow slyly crept along the wall, unnoticed by the guards.
meanings.sent5: The ninja slyly moved through the shadows, unseen by his enemies.
